argumentText:
ARGUMENT
a x y

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_dfepfr | |- ( _E Fr On <-> A. a ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 2 |  | #P_simpr | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> a =/= (/) ) |
| 3 |  | #P_n0 | |- ( a =/= (/) <-> E. x x e. a ) |
| 4 |  | #P_onfrALTlem1 | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( ( x e. a /\ ( a i^i x ) = (/) ) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 5 | 4 | #P_expd | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( x e. a -> ( ( a i^i x ) = (/) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) ) |
| 6 |  | #P_onfrALTlem2 | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( ( x e. a /\ -. ( a i^i x ) = (/) ) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 7 | 6 | #P_expd | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( x e. a -> ( -. ( a i^i x ) = (/) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) ) |
| 8 |  | #P_pm2.61 | |- ( ( ( a i^i x ) = (/) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) -> ( ( -. ( a i^i x ) = (/) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 9 | 5, 7, 8 | #P_syl6c | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( x e. a -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 10 | 9 | #P_exlimdv | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( E. x x e. a -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 11 | 3, 10 | #P_syl5bi | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> ( a =/= (/) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) ) |
| 12 | 2, 11 | #P_mpd | |- ( ( a C_ On /\ a =/= (/) ) -> E. y e. a ( a i^i y ) = (/) ) |
| 13 | 1, 12 | #P_mpgbir | |- _E Fr On |
\
 The epsilon relation is foundational on the class of ordinal numbers. ~ onfrALT is an alternate proof of ~ onfr . ~ onfrALTVD is the Virtual Deduction proof from which ~ onfrALT is derived.  The Virtual Deduction proof mirrors the working proof of ~ onfr which is the main part of the proof of Theorem 7.12 of the first edition of TakeutiZaring.  The proof of the corresponding Proposition 7.12 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38 (second edition) does not contain the working proof equivalent of ~ onfrALTVD . This theorem does not rely on the Axiom of Regularity.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 22-Jul-2012.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
